edu.psu.citeseerx.corecom
Class ObjectTransferConnection

java.lang.Object
  edu.psu.citeseerx.corecom.ObjectTransferConnection
Direct Known Subclasses:
ByteStreamTransferConnection, XStreamTransferConnection
public abstract class ObjectTransferConnection
extends java.lang.Object

Generic functionality for object transfer connections. This class sets up I/O streams from a specified socket (which should be a valid connection) and specifies the API for handling such connections. Compression is currently broken - don't use it!

Build a new ObjectTransferConnection around a specified socket.

Parameters:
socket - a raw socket to use for underlying comm
compress - whether or not to use GZip compression on I/O streams.

Method Detail

readObject

public final java.lang.Object readObject()
                                  throws java.io.IOException,
                                         java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Wrapper for underlying readObject implementation. This method handles any validation requests before passing retrieved objects to the caller. Lazily initializes the inputStream.

Returns:
object read from input stream.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

writeObject

public void writeObject(java.lang.Object obj)
                 throws java.io.IOException

validate

public final boolean validate()
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              ObjectTransferConnection.InvalidException,
                              java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Makes sure that this connection is behaving as expected. In response to a validation request, the very next object returned should be a validation response with the same ID.

Returns:
whether this connection is valid.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
